Letter not found; item is a register entry only, of a letterdated4 January 1871. See also M to J. McCulloch, 16 December 1870 (in this edition as 70-12-16a).
[In reply to question of C Levy asking whether instructions about quarters for Mr Ferguson
William Ferguson.
have been carried out]
Is this a question in parliament or a private letter? check at PRO . In the new Estimates of Expenditure that M submitted in July 1871(M to C. Duffy, 8 July 1871 (in this edition as 71-07-08b), M recommended that Ferguson be transferred to the Lands Department.On 8 July1872, the Inspector General of Public Works asked the new Chief Secretary,James Francis,to certifyFerguson'saccounts for allowance in lieu of quarters [letter not found]. This letter was referred back to the Public Works office on 13 July minuted: 'a/cs for /71-2 certified cannot do others yet'. This letter was returned to the Chief Secretary's office on 17 July, then referred again to the Public Works office on 18 July minuted: 'For paper with appl [approval] of C. S. on it'. The letter was returned to the Chief Secretary's office on 23 July and forwarded again to the Public Works office on 25 July minuted: 'Make another search for it'. The letter was returned to the Chief Secretary's office on 7 August, then forwarded again to the Public Works office on 8 August minuted: 'a/c now signed' (No. 7500, vol. 1872 B, VPRS 1168, Public Records Office, Victoria).
